intro: Bilabrella anaphysema, commonly known as the golden bell vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its pendulous, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Bilabrella anaphysema is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
